page.title: 10Walmore Common
page.content: In the winter migratory birds arrive such as Bewick's Swans and wild geese as well as gulls.The sound of the swans is as of a large party of people all talking together,catching up on each other's news.The flooding comes from the overflow of the River Severn mainly due to prolonged or heavy rain in the Welsh hill catchment area of the Severn.Because of the flooding and consequent absence of intensive farming,chemical additives or major disturbance of the habitat over the partly grazed rough pasture,an S.S.S.I.has been designated here.When the floods are up and the water freezes then it is possible to skate on the common as long as the skaters keep away from the dykes where the ice is not only weakest but the penalty for falling through could be fatal. Elsewhere the ice lies safely on grass
